page.title: 01WEST FELTON AREA DETAILS
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF WEST FELTON IS SITUATED IN THE CENTRE OF THE BLOCK,SURROUNDED BY ITS SATELLITE HAMLETS OF QUEENS HEAD,SUTTON,GRIMPO,TWYFORD,WEIRBROOK AND WOOLSTON.A DISUSED SECTION OF THE SHROPSHIRE UNION CANAL CUTS ACROSS ONE CORNER OF THE BLOCK,WITH THE REMAINS OF THE OLD ASTON LOCKS STILL VISIBLE AND A TURNING BASIN AT QUEENS HEAD.IT IS HOPED TO RE-OPEN IT IN THE NEAR FUTURE.THE VILLAGE IS SPLIT IN TWO BY THE A5 LONDON TO HOLYHEAD TRUNK ROAD BUT A BY-PASS IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION AND DUE TO BE COMPLETED IN 1987.THIS WILL NOT ONLY CHANGE THE CHARACTER OF THE VILLAGE PHYSICALLY BUT ALSO SOCIALLY,AS THE PRESENT HEAVY VOLUME OF TRAFFIC TENDS TO KEEP PEOPLE,PARTICULARLY THE ELDERLY AND THE YOUNG, TO THEIR OWN SIDE OF THE VILLAGE.
